sn16.12:4.1: At one time Venerable Mahākassapa and Venerable Sāriputta were staying near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana.
sn16.12:4.2: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Sāriputta came out of solitude, went to Venerable Mahākassapa,
sn16.12:4.4: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
sn16.12:4.6: “Reverend Kassapa, does a Realized One exist after death?”
sn16.12:4.7: “Reverend, this has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:4.9: “Well then, does a Realized One not exist after death?”
sn16.12:4.10: “This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:4.12: “Well then, does a Realized One both exist and not exist after death?”
sn16.12:4.13: “This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:4.15: “Well then, does a Realized One neither exist nor not exist after death?”
sn16.12:4.16: “This too has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:4.18: “And why has this not been declared by the Buddha?”
sn16.12:4.19: “Because it’s not beneficial or relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. It doesn’t lead to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn16.12:4.20: That’s why it has not been declared by the Buddha.”
sn16.12:5.1: “So what now has been declared by the Buddha?”
sn16.12:5.2: “‘This is suffering’ has been declared by the Buddha.
sn16.12:5.5: ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering’ has been declared by the Buddha.
sn16.12:5.6: “And why has this been declared by the Buddha?”
sn16.12:5.7: “Because it’s beneficial and relevant to the fundamentals of the spiritual life. It leads to disillusionment, fading away, cessation, peace, insight, awakening, and extinguishment.
sn16.12:5.8: That’s why it has been declared by the Buddha.”
